visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing agricultural production comparison across 10 major producing nations using synthetic data generation with statistical validity and domain-appropriate value ranges

subtitle.text: Synthetic data demonstrating statistical generation principles

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two-dimensional categorical-numerical data comparing production quantities across geographic entities. Synthetic values maintain agricultural production patterns: corn shows μ=116,210 with σ=126,380 reflecting staple crop variability, while wheat demonstrates μ=65,690 with σ=45,920 capturing regional specialization. Generated values preserve ordinal relationships (USA > China > Brazil) while introducing controlled noise (±15% std dev). The column chart maximizes data-ink ratio through direct value labels and dual-color encoding, aligning with Cairo's magnitude perception principles. Proportional column widths and y-axis zero-baseline enforce accurate quantitative comparison. Trend preservation in synthetic data maintains USA corn dominance while showing wheat clustering in EU/Russia/Canada regions.
